title: Newton's Laws: Forces and Motion Analysis

vocab.definition: An object at rest stays at rest, an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by a force
The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to net force and inversely proportional to mass
For every action force, there is an equal and opposite reaction force
The vector sum of all forces acting on an object
The tendency of an object to resist changes in its motion

teachingNotes: Use free body diagrams to analyze forces. Practice applying F = ma to solve complex motion problems.

sample.question: What states that an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by a force?

truefalse.question: Newton's second law states that F = ma.

multiplechoice.question: What is the vector sum of all forces acting on an object?

fillintheblank.question: The tendency of an object to resist changes in motion is called ________.

shortanswer.question: Explain Newton's third law with an example.
expectedAny: walking pushes ground, ground pushes back
